page.title: 03NEWTON NURSERY,ELGIN
page.content:
Newton Nursery,Elgin
The nursery,formerly a farm, was bought by the Forestry Commission in 1931. It extends to 34 hectares. Seeds from good trees throughout Britain are sent from a seed extraction unit at Farnham in Surrey. Newton produces 9-10 million trees for planting each year. 95% go to the Forestry Commission and the rest to the private forests. Varieties grown are Scots Pine, Lodgepole Pine, larch, Douglas Fir and Sitka Spruce, which makes up 80% of the total. There is a growing demand for hardwoods. Newton used to employ over 40 men. However, with mechanisation, chemical weed control, irrigation and cold storage only 16 are employed at present. The main pests are greenfinches, rabbits and hares.
